title: Sunset magazine font help
content:
Any pros want to help with this? I looked at Dis XBold Roman but it's not quite there. Is it an easy one I'm missing? I'm assuming it's the same font just in an black and roman/light version?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459im_/http:/typophile.com/files/piecesofhome_3648.jpg)
author: cohoss

comments.content: Yes, you're right, it's different weights of [Guardian Egyptian](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/gdnegyp.shtml), not yet available for licencing.

Thank you for the ID. Dang. It's a beautiful font, perfect for a project I'm working on. I'll watch out for it in time :-)

Thanks again!

I agree, it's a very well conceived and executed piece of work.  
You might Schwartz's other font [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/) though that may be a bit on the fat side.  
Others in a similar style:  
 [Oranda](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/oranda/)  
 [FF Olsen](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/olsen/)  
More slabby:  
 [Qugard Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/qugard-slab/)  
Perhaps [FF Zine](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/zine-slab/)

Thanks for the suggestions. I like Olsen if it had a bit more of a heavy weight. The Guardian's heavier weights look beautiful to me -- just the right mix of casual and slab I was looking for. I'll spec out these others and see how they work. I appreciate the help!

Take a look at Stag. It's got a nice range of weights, including a very black black.

[http://vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000459/http:/vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/")

I do like Stag. For my budget I'll probably only be able to do light and bold -- the black is a little too thick compared to what I was looking for. I hate when I get my mind set on a particular font. I'll definitely be on the lookout if Guardian becomes available down the road.

Just wanted to give folks an update that Christian contacted me to say that Guardian Egyptian is available. He has the details. He has been a pleasure to work with and I'm excited to be able to use this for my original project.
hehe. you would have got there a bit earlier if you had followed my link above :P

Wow, glad you got what you wanted. It's never the same using something close to what you want.

Paul, that commercialtype website doesn't do anything...unless it's me? There's nothing to click.
